results.title: [Tony Agapitos: Easter celebrations at Green Hill]
results.brief_description:
This film shows Greek Easter celebrations, including a community BBQ, cooking lamb on a spit, music and dancing.

This film is part of a collection of 16mm films made by Tony Agapitos. The collection offers a glimpse at Greek migrant life in Victoria from the 1950s to the 1970s.

results.title: A Continent on guard
results.creator_credit: Bob Walker, Peter Johnson and Film Australia
results.brief_description: Presents a dramatic, simulated investigation into a suspected outbreak of foot and mouth disease in Australia, and points out what measures would be taken to eradicate the disease. Note: A complementary production to ‘The constant threat’

results.title: Nick Mount: glass blower
results.creator_credit: Terry McMahon, Nina Syme and Victorian Film Corporation
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Craft as a Livelihood”.
Nick Mount, a glass blower, discusses the skills necessary for his craft and the type of work he does himself. Shows him at work at his country property where he works three to four weeks at a time.

results.title: Women breakout
results.creator_credit: Erika Addis and Halfway House Collective
results.brief_description: This film was made by the Halfway House Collective in Melbourne and is set in Halfway House a feminist refuge. The film does not so much focus on the circumstances that led them to the Halfway House, rather it shows the house giving them support to take control of and change their lives.
results.description: This film was made by the Halfway House Collective in Melbourne and is set in Halfway House a feminist refuge. results.title: Assertive skills training (TEFC)
results.creator_credit: Chrysalis Films and South Australian Film Corporation
results.brief_description: This program uses a series of playlets to illustrate unassertive behaviour, the benefits resulting from assertive behaviour and better communication in personal interactions. The six segments are entitled; Work, Couples, Families, Conversations, Requests, Neighbours.

results.title: Factory production
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Living with Computers”.
Expert, Russell Lansbury, talks about the use of computers in factory production, a paper presented to the Junior World Computer Congress, Melbourne, October 16-18, 1980.
